intro: Dissotis entii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces small, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored, ranging from white to purple. Its leaves are usually velvety and dark green, providing a striking contrast to the flowers. Dissotis entii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
